column5: My heaviest rod is a 6'6 Shimano, MH action, spinning.  Would this be alright for pike fishing, or would I be pushing my luck?
what reel, line and so forth would help.  I have caught pike on MH 6'6" MH rod's but the rest of the gear set's the stage as welll...

oh ya your fine unless your out for big momma pike. i normally use a shimano 6'6" medium fast action with 10lb mono and 2500 series reel. the biggest pike i got on that setup was 15lb. i've got alot of 5-12lbers on that setup also. you'll be fine and you'll have more of a fun time reeling in the big one

It all depends on the size of lure you fishing with 3/8oz or 1oz or heaver. You will have trouble casting bigger baits. The heaver the lure the bigger the fish. Don't get it wrong, small lures will catch big fish. Its just more often you will catch 5-10lber. I have landed 20+ channel cats on my 6'6 mh Shimano Compre fine.  tight lines
Just don't be tossing big baits with that rod, you will snap it!! If you are just using a bobber hook and sucker, you'll be more than fine.
Early season pike, when I've throwing smaller baits, I still use a lot of spinning gear, you should be fine
